thread.title: Inside the UFO treehouse hotel that appears to hover above the ground
thread.title_full: Inside the UFO treehouse hotel that appears to hover above the ground | Daily Mail Online

author: Ted Thornhill for MailOnline
title: Inside the UFO treehouse hotel that appears to hover above the ground
text:
26 shares 6
View
comments
The concept of treehouses may not be a new thing - but Treehotel's UFO themed room is out of this world.
As you walk through the serene Swedish forest, a completely alien metal construction rises 6m off the floor and into the treetops.
A spotlight shines down over a staircase leading visitors into the room, making the structure look as though it's hovering to land.
Scroll down for video
Heavens above: As you walk through a serene Swedish forest north of Stockholm a completely alien metal construction rises 6m off the floor and into the treetops
A spotlight shines down over a staircase leading visitors into the room, making the structure look as though it's hovering to land
Inside the UFO Treehotel the space is decorated like the inside of a spaceship, down to cushions with constellation patterns embroidered into them
Inside, the space is decorated like the inside of a spaceship, down to cushions with constellation patterns embroidered into them.

Other rooms on the site near Harads - around 550miles (876km) north of Stockholm - include one in the shape of a birds nest.
Co-owner Kent Lundvall said: 'While working on the Bird's Nest, which is largely in harmony with its surroundings, the idea of creating an entirely different environment was born.

Other rooms on the site near Harads - around 550miles (876km) north of Stockholm - include one in the shape of a birds nest
Co-owner Kent Lundvall said: 'While working on the Bird's Nest, which is largely in harmony with its surroundings, the idea of creating an entirely different environment was born'
'And what could be more different than an UFO?
'The Treehotel offers guests a unique hotel experience - tree rooms with contemporary design in the middle of unspoiled nature.
'Here you can forget about the time constraints of everyday life, enjoy the serenity and rejuvenate in a sophisticated yet familiar environment.'
The UFO is built for five people, two adults in a double bed and three children, with separate beds, bathroom and living area.
The room is cast in durable composite material - all to create the lightest yet strong and sustainable design possible.
Kent caters for businesses, too, with the 'Dragonfly' (pictured) offering 'a well-equipped conference room for groups up to 12 people'
Steamy: Guests at Treehotel can also enjoy a tree sauna (pictured), hot tub and a 'custom-designed relaxation area'
Inside the Treehotel sauna, which has room for eight people. Towels and slippers and all provided, according to the owner
Kent added: 'A very important part of our concept is to consider ecological values and make minimal environmental impact.
'For this reason we devote considerable resources to finding sustainable construction and energy solutions.'
The rooms, which were designed together with some of Scandinavia's leading architects, all have spectacular views of the Lule River.
Treehotel was inspired by the film The Tree Lover by Jonas Selberg Augustsen, a tale of three men from the city who want to go back to their roots by building a tree house together.
Other amenities in the resort include Britta's Pensionat where guests are served breakfast, lunch and dinner in an authentic 1930-1950's setting, alongside another restaurant, bar and sauna.
'The Cabin' (pictured) is another bizarre room that is available to rent in the forest. Treehotel's website describes it as 'like a capsule, a foreign body in the trees'. It has a double bed, bathroom and terrace
